segment.source: On/Off Transition Performance
segment.target: On/Off Transition Performance

segment.source: On/Off Transition Performance
segment.target: On/Off Transition Performance

segment.source: On/Off Transition Performance
segment.target: On/Off Transition Performance

segment.source: The On/Off Transition Performance assessments measure the transitions from various computer states, like:
segment.target: The On/Off Transition Performance assessments measure the transitions from various computer states, like:

segment.source: Power-on transitions, including boot, resume from standby (S3), and resume from hibernate (S4).
segment.target: Power-on transitions, including boot, resume from standby (S3), and resume from hibernate (S4).

segment.source: Power-off transitions, including shut down, enter standby (S3), and enter hibernate (S4).
segment.target: Power-off transitions, including shut down, enter standby (S3), and enter hibernate (S4).

segment.source: The boot interval, which is the interval between the time the power button is pressed, and the time when the computer reaches the desktop and processes all startup tasks.
segment.target: The boot interval, which is the interval between the time the power button is pressed, and the time when the computer reaches the desktop and processes all startup tasks.

segment.source: The shutdown interval, which is the interval between when the shutdown process is initiated, and when the computer is turned off.
segment.target: The shutdown interval, which is the interval between when the shutdown process is initiated, and when the computer is turned off.

segment.source: Four On/Off Transition Performance assessments are available.
segment.target: Four On/Off Transition Performance assessments are available.

segment.source: This topic describes the Boot Performance (Fast Startup), Hibernate Performance, and Standby Performance assessments.
segment.target: This topic describes the Boot Performance (Fast Startup), Hibernate Performance, and Standby Performance assessments.

segment.source: This graphic illustrates the assessment process:
segment.target: This graphic illustrates the assessment process:

segment.source: workflow graphic for on/off transition performance
segment.target: workflow graphic for on/off transition performance

segment.source: In this topic:
segment.target: In this topic:

segment.source: About On/Off Transition Performance Assessments
segment.target: About On/Off Transition Performance Assessments

segment.source: Before You Begin
segment.target: Before You Begin

segment.source: Settings
segment.target: Settings

segment.source: Results
segment.target: Results

segment.source: Issues
segment.target: Issues

segment.source: For more information about how to analyze results for the Boot (Fast Startup) assessment, see Results for the On/Off Assessments.
segment.target: For more information about how to analyze results for the Boot (Fast Startup) assessment, see Results for the On/Off Assessments.

segment.source: About On/Off Transition Performance Assessments
segment.target: About On/Off Transition Performance Assessments

segment.source: Each On/Off Transition Performance assessment evaluates one of these transitions:
segment.target: Each On/Off Transition Performance assessment evaluates one of these transitions:

segment.source: Transition
segment.target: Transition

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: Boot (fast startup)
segment.target: Boot (fast startup)

segment.source: The Boot Performance (Fast Startup) assessment measures the performance of a new fast-startup transition.
segment.target: The Boot Performance (Fast Startup) assessment measures the performance of a new fast-startup transition.

segment.source: Windows 8introduces a boot process that enables faster startup of your computer under most conditions.
segment.target: Windows 8introduces a boot process that enables faster startup of your computer under most conditions.

segment.source: The shutdown process has been updated to include writing data to disk, in a way that resembles how hibernate works.
segment.target: The shutdown process has been updated to include writing data to disk, in a way that resembles how hibernate works.

segment.source: You initiate this process by shutting down the computer.
segment.target: You initiate this process by shutting down the computer.

segment.source: When you press the power button, the computer will turn on and Windows will start by using the fast startup process.
segment.target: When you press the power button, the computer will turn on and Windows will start by using the fast startup process.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: If fast startup is turned off in Power Options, both shutdown and restart occur as full reboots.
segment.target: If fast startup is turned off in Power Options, both shutdown and restart occur as full reboots.

segment.source: Standby
segment.target: Standby

segment.source: The Standby Performance assessment helps you identify the components that have the most impact on the transition between the system states of on and suspend.
segment.target: The Standby Performance assessment helps you identify the components that have the most impact on the transition between the system states of on and suspend.

segment.source: Suspend is the sleep state in which the computer enters a low-power state (S3) and consumes a very low amount of power.
segment.target: Suspend is the sleep state in which the computer enters a low-power state (S3) and consumes a very low amount of power.

segment.source: Standby is the act of entering the suspend state.
segment.target: Standby is the act of entering the suspend state.

segment.source: The transition from standby-sleep back to standby-resume is the interval between the time when the computer initiates wake-up and the time when the computer becomes usable and responsive.
segment.target: The transition from standby-sleep back to standby-resume is the interval between the time when the computer initiates wake-up and the time when the computer becomes usable and responsive.

segment.source: This is the time after the user presses the power button or a USB device button (if the computer is configured for wake-on-USB), which is sometime after the desktop appears.
segment.target: This is the time after the user presses the power button or a USB device button (if the computer is configured for wake-on-USB), which is sometime after the desktop appears.

segment.source: Hibernate
segment.target: Hibernate

segment.source: The Hibernate Performance assessment helps you identify the components that have the most impact on the transition between the system states of hibernate and resume.
segment.target: The Hibernate Performance assessment helps you identify the components that have the most impact on the transition between the system states of hibernate and resume.

segment.source: Hibernate is the sleep state in which system and user data is written to disk in a hiberfile.
segment.target: Hibernate is the sleep state in which system and user data is written to disk in a hiberfile.

segment.source: Then, the system enters the lowest sleep state (S4), and the power is cut.
segment.target: Then, the system enters the lowest sleep state (S4), and the power is cut.

segment.source: The transition from hibernate back to wake-up from hibernate is the interval between the time when the user initiates wake-up from hibernate (by pressing the power button or a USB device button if the computer is configured for wake-on-USB) and the time when the computer becomes usable and responsive (sometime after the desktop appears).
segment.target: The transition from hibernate back to wake-up from hibernate is the interval between the time when the user initiates wake-up from hibernate (by pressing the power button or a USB device button if the computer is configured for wake-on-USB) and the time when the computer becomes usable and responsive (sometime after the desktop appears).

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: A hiberfile (Hiberfil.sys) is a file that the operating system creates when the computer enters hibernate mode.
segment.target: A hiberfile (Hiberfil.sys) is a file that the operating system creates when the computer enters hibernate mode.

segment.source: When the computer is turned on, Windows uses this file to return the system to its pre-hibernate state.
segment.target: When the computer is turned on, Windows uses this file to return the system to its pre-hibernate state.

segment.source: Effect of fast startup on boot performance
segment.target: Effect of fast startup on boot performance

segment.source: The default shutdown and reboot scenario has changed in Windows 8.
segment.target: The default shutdown and reboot scenario has changed in Windows 8.

segment.source: The shutdown process now includes writing data to disk in a way that resembles how the hibernate state works.
segment.target: The shutdown process now includes writing data to disk in a way that resembles how the hibernate state works.

segment.source: A key difference between the shutdown and reboot of Windows 8 and the shutdown and reboot of previous Windows versions is that all user sessions are logged off normally and the remaining information is written to a hiberfile.
segment.target: A key difference between the shutdown and reboot of Windows 8 and the shutdown and reboot of previous Windows versions is that all user sessions are logged off normally and the remaining information is written to a hiberfile.

segment.source: Logon remains the same as it was in the previous Windows versions.
segment.target: Logon remains the same as it was in the previous Windows versions.

segment.source: The new boot process in Windows 8 is usually much faster, as shown here:
segment.target: The new boot process in Windows 8 is usually much faster, as shown here:

segment.source: comparison of windows 8 to previous boot process The traditional Windows boot process loads the operating system's kernel, device drivers, and other system component files into memory and loads the logon screen and desktop.
segment.target: comparison of windows 8 to previous boot process The traditional Windows boot process loads the operating system's kernel, device drivers, and other system component files into memory and loads the logon screen and desktop.

segment.source: Fast startup provides performance benefits by avoiding some of the work that's traditionally required at boot time.
segment.target: Fast startup provides performance benefits by avoiding some of the work that's traditionally required at boot time.

segment.source: The benefits of this new shutdown/boot transition are immediately noticeable.
segment.target: The benefits of this new shutdown/boot transition are immediately noticeable.

segment.source: There are still several areas where device drivers, services, applications, and other features can adversely affect this scenario.
segment.target: There are still several areas where device drivers, services, applications, and other features can adversely affect this scenario.

segment.source: The Boot Performance (Fast Startup) assessment enables you to measure the time of each phase in the scenario, provides insight into what is being run during each subphase, identifies potential issues, and provides remediation guidance for ecosystem partners to improve their products.
segment.target: The Boot Performance (Fast Startup) assessment enables you to measure the time of each phase in the scenario, provides insight into what is being run during each subphase, identifies potential issues, and provides remediation guidance for ecosystem partners to improve their products.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: The traditional Windows boot is still sometimes required on a computer that's running Windows 8.
segment.target: The traditional Windows boot is still sometimes required on a computer that's running Windows 8.

segment.source: You can initiate it by pressing Ctrl+Alt+Delete, choosing the power icon, and then choosing Restart.
segment.target: You can initiate it by pressing Ctrl+Alt+Delete, choosing the power icon, and then choosing Restart.

segment.source: When the computer reboots, it uses the traditional boot process.
segment.target: When the computer reboots, it uses the traditional boot process.

segment.source: Before You Begin
segment.target: Before You Begin

segment.source: The first-run help tips in Windows 8.1 can negatively affect assessment results.
segment.target: The first-run help tips in Windows 8.1 can negatively affect assessment results.

segment.source: To disable these, run the following command from an elevated command prompt, and reboot the computer:
segment.target: To disable these, run the following command from an elevated command prompt, and reboot the computer:

segment.source: To obtain the most accurate and reproducible results from these assessments, set up and prepare the system by performing these actions:
segment.target: To obtain the most accurate and reproducible results from these assessments, set up and prepare the system by performing these actions:

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: Before the On/Off Transition Performance assessments run, they verify that the supported sleep states are available.
segment.target: Before the On/Off Transition Performance assessments run, they verify that the supported sleep states are available.

segment.source: If a precheck confirms that a required sleep state is not enabled, the assessments won't run.
segment.target: If a precheck confirms that a required sleep state is not enabled, the assessments won't run.

segment.source: Because these assessments perform several reboots, we recommend that you set up your system to automate the logon process.
segment.target: Because these assessments perform several reboots, we recommend that you set up your system to automate the logon process.

segment.source: To do this, see Automate reboots before you run an assessment.
segment.target: To do this, see Automate reboots before you run an assessment.

segment.source: Warning
segment.target: Warning

segment.source: Don't interact with your computer while the assessment is running.
segment.target: Don't interact with your computer while the assessment is running.

segment.source: This might adversely affect the results.
segment.target: This might adversely affect the results.

segment.source: Automating the logon process can help prevent unwanted interaction.
segment.target: Automating the logon process can help prevent unwanted interaction.

segment.source: Make sure that all device drivers are correctly installed.
segment.target: Make sure that all device drivers are correctly installed.

segment.source: Results may vary significantly if your computer has missing or incorrect drivers.
segment.target: Results may vary significantly if your computer has missing or incorrect drivers.

segment.source: You can use the Driver Verification assessment to identify driver issues on the computer that you want to assess.
segment.target: You can use the Driver Verification assessment to identify driver issues on the computer that you want to assess.

segment.source: Verify that the correct video card and driver are installed.
segment.target: Verify that the correct video card and driver are installed.

segment.source: If you have only the Microsoft® Basic Display Adapter installed, the Standby Performance assessment can't run.
segment.target: If you have only the Microsoft® Basic Display Adapter installed, the Standby Performance assessment can't run.

segment.source: Determine whether your system BIOS has been configured to boot from the network, have a CD/DVD inserted into optical drive, BitLocker enabled, or have a multi-boot scenario.
segment.target: Determine whether your system BIOS has been configured to boot from the network, have a CD/DVD inserted into optical drive, BitLocker enabled, or have a multi-boot scenario.

segment.source: These configurations can cause delays in the boot path, and are likely to adversely affect your results.
segment.target: These configurations can cause delays in the boot path, and are likely to adversely affect your results.

segment.source: If your system has a multi-boot configuration, a menu for selecting an operating system will appear at startup.
segment.target: If your system has a multi-boot configuration, a menu for selecting an operating system will appear at startup.

segment.source: The presence of this menu will affect the job results.
segment.target: The presence of this menu will affect the job results.

segment.source: System requirements
segment.target: System requirements

segment.source: You can run the assessments on these operating systems:
segment.target: You can run the assessments on these operating systems:

segment.source: Windows 8
segment.target: Windows 8

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: Supported architectures include x86-based and x64-based systems.
segment.target: Supported architectures include x86-based and x64-based systems.

segment.source: Settings
segment.target: Settings

segment.source: By default, these assessments use the recommended settings.
segment.target: By default, these assessments use the recommended settings.

segment.source: Microsoft defines these settings so that you can compare the results across multiple computer configurations or over time on the same computer.
segment.target: Microsoft defines these settings so that you can compare the results across multiple computer configurations or over time on the same computer.

segment.source: When you review the results, the run information includes metadata that indicates whether the assessment used the recommended settings.
segment.target: When you review the results, the run information includes metadata that indicates whether the assessment used the recommended settings.

segment.source: You can also customize the settings for an assessment, if you want to gather data that's different from the default data.
segment.target: You can also customize the settings for an assessment, if you want to gather data that's different from the default data.

segment.source: For example, you might identify specific data that would help you perform a detailed analysis of a particular aspect of the computer.
segment.target: For example, you might identify specific data that would help you perform a detailed analysis of a particular aspect of the computer.

segment.source: The following table describes the assessment settings that are available for these assessments, in addition to recommended values, and alternative values for each setting.
segment.target: The following table describes the assessment settings that are available for these assessments, in addition to recommended values, and alternative values for each setting.

segment.source: Setting
segment.target: Setting

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: Use recommended settings
segment.target: Use recommended settings

segment.source: Specifies whether the assessment runs by using the default values.
segment.target: Specifies whether the assessment runs by using the default values.

segment.source: By default, this check box is selected.
segment.target: By default, this check box is selected.

segment.source: To change the settings for this assessment, you must first clear this check box.
segment.target: To change the settings for this assessment, you must first clear this check box.

segment.source: Number of Iterations
segment.target: Number of Iterations

segment.source: Specifies the number of times that the assessment performs reboots to time the shutdown and boot process.
segment.target: Specifies the number of times that the assessment performs reboots to time the shutdown and boot process.

segment.source: By default, the value is 3.
segment.target: By default, the value is 3.

segment.source: Perform an initial reboot
segment.target: Perform an initial reboot

segment.source: Specifies whether to reboot the system before the assessment runs.
segment.target: Specifies whether to reboot the system before the assessment runs.

segment.source: This setting is used in the Hibernate Performance and Standby Performance assessments, but not in the Boot Performance (Fast Startup) assessment.
segment.target: This setting is used in the Hibernate Performance and Standby Performance assessments, but not in the Boot Performance (Fast Startup) assessment.

segment.source: Use alternate WPR profile
segment.target: Use alternate WPR profile

segment.source: By default, this check box is cleared.
segment.target: By default, this check box is cleared.

segment.source: Select it if you want to use a Windows Performance Recorder (WPR) profile other than the default.
segment.target: Select it if you want to use a Windows Performance Recorder (WPR) profile other than the default.

segment.source: If this check box is selected, you must enter the path of another WPR profile.
segment.target: If this check box is selected, you must enter the path of another WPR profile.

segment.source: Path to alternate trace profile (.wprp)
segment.target: Path to alternate trace profile (.wprp)

segment.source: Provides the path of an alternative WPR profile.
segment.target: Provides the path of an alternative WPR profile.

segment.source: To specify an alternative path, select the Use alternate WPR profile check box, and then type the path in the Path to alternate trace profile box.
segment.target: To specify an alternative path, select the Use alternate WPR profile check box, and then type the path in the Path to alternate trace profile box.

segment.source: Enable Minifilter Diagnostic Mode
segment.target: Enable Minifilter Diagnostic Mode

segment.source: Specifies whether to use the minifilter diagnostic option.
segment.target: Specifies whether to use the minifilter diagnostic option.

segment.source: By default, this check box is cleared.
segment.target: By default, this check box is cleared.

segment.source: When the minifilter diagnostic mode is enabled, it produces metrics that help you evaluate the effect of minifilters on boot performance.
segment.target: When the minifilter diagnostic mode is enabled, it produces metrics that help you evaluate the effect of minifilters on boot performance.

segment.source: For more information about this setting, see Minifilter Diagnostics.
segment.target: For more information about this setting, see Minifilter Diagnostics.

segment.source: This setting is available only in the Boot Performance (Fast Startup) assessment.
segment.target: This setting is available only in the Boot Performance (Fast Startup) assessment.

segment.source: Collect I/O trace file
segment.target: Collect I/O trace file

segment.source: By default, this check box is cleared.
segment.target: By default, this check box is cleared.

segment.source: Select it if you want to collect a storage IO trace in addition to the default CPU trace.
segment.target: Select it if you want to collect a storage IO trace in addition to the default CPU trace.

segment.source: This setting is available only in the Boot Performance (Fast Startup) assessment.
segment.target: This setting is available only in the Boot Performance (Fast Startup) assessment.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: The minifilter results appear only if you select the Enable Minifilter Diagnostic Mode check box before you run the assessment.
segment.target: The minifilter results appear only if you select the Enable Minifilter Diagnostic Mode check box before you run the assessment.

segment.source: Results
segment.target: Results

segment.source: The results show metrics for the boot, standby, and hibernate performance of the computer.
segment.target: The results show metrics for the boot, standby, and hibernate performance of the computer.

segment.source: Some of the metrics have additional information that you can view by expanding them.
segment.target: Some of the metrics have additional information that you can view by expanding them.

segment.source: The On/Off Transition assessments perform a series of on/off transitions while the assessment is running.
segment.target: The On/Off Transition assessments perform a series of on/off transitions while the assessment is running.

segment.source: A single series of transitions performed by an assessment is referred to as an iteration.
segment.target: A single series of transitions performed by an assessment is referred to as an iteration.

segment.source: There are three different types of iterations: Timing, Analysis, and I/O Analysis.
segment.target: There are three different types of iterations: Timing, Analysis, and I/O Analysis.

segment.source: Timing iterations.
segment.target: Timing iterations.

segment.source: These iterations serve as a basis for the metric values for all shutdown and boot metrics that are captured.
segment.target: These iterations serve as a basis for the metric values for all shutdown and boot metrics that are captured.

segment.source: Each On/Off transition assessment performs three timing iterations by default and collects three Timing ETL traces.
segment.target: Each On/Off transition assessment performs three timing iterations by default and collects three Timing ETL traces.

segment.source: The metric values presented are the average values between all timing iterations.
segment.target: The metric values presented are the average values between all timing iterations.

segment.source: To see the values for individual iterations, in the Results View, right-click the results column header and then choose Show iterations.
segment.target: To see the values for individual iterations, in the Results View, right-click the results column header and then choose Show iterations.

segment.source: Analysis iteration.
segment.target: Analysis iteration.

segment.source: This iteration collects information while the assessment is running and serves as basis for issues generated by the assessments.
segment.target: This iteration collects information while the assessment is running and serves as basis for issues generated by the assessments.

segment.source: Because of the additional tracing overhead, the operations in this iteration can take longer than in a general use case.
segment.target: Because of the additional tracing overhead, the operations in this iteration can take longer than in a general use case.

segment.source: Keep this discrepancy (metrics arising from the timing iterations and issues arising from the analysis iteration) in mind when triaging and analyzing assessment results.
segment.target: Keep this discrepancy (metrics arising from the timing iterations and issues arising from the analysis iteration) in mind when triaging and analyzing assessment results.

segment.source: I/O Analysis Iteration.
segment.target: I/O Analysis Iteration.

segment.source: This iteration collects a trace with very detailed information about the I/O subsystem and registry accesses.
segment.target: This iteration collects a trace with very detailed information about the I/O subsystem and registry accesses.

segment.source: This trace type is not collected by default, to enable it select the Collect I/O trace file assessment settings before running the assessment.
segment.target: This trace type is not collected by default, to enable it select the Collect I/O trace file assessment settings before running the assessment.

segment.source: The assessments perform 3 reboots by default to capture the actual timing duration for each iteration of the shutdown and boot process.
segment.target: The assessments perform 3 reboots by default to capture the actual timing duration for each iteration of the shutdown and boot process.

segment.source: This table provides a brief description of the metrics that the On/Off Transition Performance assessments capture:
segment.target: This table provides a brief description of the metrics that the On/Off Transition Performance assessments capture:

segment.source: Metric
segment.target: Metric

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: Assessment
segment.target: Assessment

segment.source: Bios Initialization Duration
segment.target: Bios Initialization Duration

segment.source: The time, in seconds, to initialize the BIOS, including the Pre-Boot Execution Environment (PXE).
segment.target: The time, in seconds, to initialize the BIOS, including the Pre-Boot Execution Environment (PXE).

segment.source: Boot Performance, Standby Performance, Hibernate Performance
segment.target: Boot Performance, Standby Performance, Hibernate Performance

segment.source: Explorer Initialization Duration
segment.target: Explorer Initialization Duration

segment.source: The time to initialize Internet Explorer.
segment.target: The time to initialize Internet Explorer.

segment.source: Includes details to show total CPU use, in milliseconds, and total disk use, in kilobytes.
segment.target: Includes details to show total CPU use, in milliseconds, and total disk use, in kilobytes.

segment.source: Also shows details for all processes for Internet Explorer initialization.
segment.target: Also shows details for all processes for Internet Explorer initialization.

segment.source: Boot Performance
segment.target: Boot Performance

segment.source: Flush Storage Volumes Duration
segment.target: Flush Storage Volumes Duration

segment.source: The time, in seconds, to flush all dirty data and persistent storage.
segment.target: The time, in seconds, to flush all dirty data and persistent storage.

segment.source: Boot Performance, Standby Performance, Hibernate Performance
segment.target: Boot Performance, Standby Performance, Hibernate Performance

segment.source: Hiberfile Initialize Duration
segment.target: Hiberfile Initialize Duration

segment.source: The time, in seconds, to initialize the hiberfile.
segment.target: The time, in seconds, to initialize the hiberfile.

segment.source: Boot Performance, Hibernate Performance
segment.target: Boot Performance, Hibernate Performance

segment.source: Hiberfile Read Duration
segment.target: Hiberfile Read Duration

segment.source: The time, in milliseconds, that the operating system took to read the hiberfile.
segment.target: The time, in milliseconds, that the operating system took to read the hiberfile.

segment.source: Boot Performance, Hibernate Performance
segment.target: Boot Performance, Hibernate Performance

segment.source: Hiberfile Write Duration
segment.target: Hiberfile Write Duration

segment.source: The total time, in milliseconds, that the operating system took to write the hiberfile.
segment.target: The total time, in milliseconds, that the operating system took to write the hiberfile.

segment.source: Boot Performance, Hibernate Performance
segment.target: Boot Performance, Hibernate Performance

segment.source: Main Path Boot Duration
segment.target: Main Path Boot Duration

segment.source: For the Boot Performance assessment, this is the time, in seconds, to resume from the end of BIOS initialization until Windows is initialized.
segment.target: For the Boot Performance assessment, this is the time, in seconds, to resume from the end of BIOS initialization until Windows is initialized.

segment.source: This does not include the Post On/Off Duration metric time.
segment.target: This does not include the Post On/Off Duration metric time.

segment.source: For Standby and Hibernate Performance assessments, this is the time, in seconds, to resume from the end of BIOS initialization until Windows is resumed, not including the Post On/Off Duration metric time.
segment.target: For Standby and Hibernate Performance assessments, this is the time, in seconds, to resume from the end of BIOS initialization until Windows is resumed, not including the Post On/Off Duration metric time.

segment.source: Boot Performance, Standby Performance, Hibernate Performance
segment.target: Boot Performance, Standby Performance, Hibernate Performance

segment.source: Main Path Resume Duration
segment.target: Main Path Resume Duration

segment.source: The time, in seconds, to resume from end of BIOS to an initialized Windows desktop.
segment.target: The time, in seconds, to resume from end of BIOS to an initialized Windows desktop.

segment.source: Boot Performance, Standby Performance, Hibernate Performance
segment.target: Boot Performance, Standby Performance, Hibernate Performance

segment.source: Post On/Off Duration
segment.target: Post On/Off Duration

segment.source: The time, in milliseconds, that Windows took to complete all startup tasks after the desktop appeared.
segment.target: The time, in milliseconds, that Windows took to complete all startup tasks after the desktop appeared.

segment.source: Boot Performance, Hibernate Performance
segment.target: Boot Performance, Hibernate Performance

segment.source: Query Devices Duration
segment.target: Query Devices Duration

segment.source: The time, in seconds, to query all devices for a suspend power transition.
segment.target: The time, in seconds, to query all devices for a suspend power transition.

segment.source: Boot Performance, Standby Performance, Hibernate Performance
segment.target: Boot Performance, Standby Performance, Hibernate Performance

segment.source: Resume Devices Duration
segment.target: Resume Devices Duration

segment.source: The time, in seconds, that the operating system took resume devices during the Resume Devices process.
segment.target: The time, in seconds, that the operating system took resume devices during the Resume Devices process.

segment.source: Boot Performance, Standby Performance, Hibernate Performance
segment.target: Boot Performance, Standby Performance, Hibernate Performance

segment.source: Superfetch Prepare Memory Duration
segment.target: Superfetch Prepare Memory Duration

segment.source: The time, in seconds, to prepare system memory for an optimized resume experience.
segment.target: The time, in seconds, to prepare system memory for an optimized resume experience.

segment.source: Boot Performance, Standby Performance, Hibernate Performance
segment.target: Boot Performance, Standby Performance, Hibernate Performance

segment.source: Suspend Devices Duration
segment.target: Suspend Devices Duration

segment.source: The time, in seconds, to suspend all devices.
segment.target: The time, in seconds, to suspend all devices.

segment.source: Boot Performance, Standby Performance, Hibernate Performance
segment.target: Boot Performance, Standby Performance, Hibernate Performance

segment.source: Suspend Processes Duration
segment.target: Suspend Processes Duration

segment.source: The time, in milliseconds, that the operating system took to suspend processes during the assessment.
segment.target: The time, in milliseconds, that the operating system took to suspend processes during the assessment.

segment.source: If available, expand it to see more information about the processes for the Suspend phase.
segment.target: If available, expand it to see more information about the processes for the Suspend phase.

segment.source: This information includes details about subphase durations, CPU use, and disk use.
segment.target: This information includes details about subphase durations, CPU use, and disk use.

segment.source: Boot Performance, Standby Performance, Hibernate Performance
segment.target: Boot Performance, Standby Performance, Hibernate Performance

segment.source: Suspend Services Duration
segment.target: Suspend Services Duration

segment.source: The time, in milliseconds, that the operating system took to suspend services during the assessment.
segment.target: The time, in milliseconds, that the operating system took to suspend services during the assessment.

segment.source: If available, expand it to see more information about the time that each subphase took.
segment.target: If available, expand it to see more information about the time that each subphase took.

segment.source: Boot Performance, Standby Performance, Hibernate Performance
segment.target: Boot Performance, Standby Performance, Hibernate Performance

segment.source: System Session Shutdown Processes Duration
segment.target: System Session Shutdown Processes Duration

segment.source: The time, in seconds, to shut down the processes in the system session.

segment.source: If you enabled the Enable Minifilter Diagnostic Mode setting, the assessment results will include minifilter metrics.
segment.target: If you enabled the Enable Minifilter Diagnostic Mode setting, the assessment results will include minifilter metrics.

segment.source: For more information about minifilter metrics and results, see Minifilter Diagnostics.
segment.target: For more information about minifilter metrics and results, see Minifilter Diagnostics.

segment.source: For more information about how to analyze results for the Boot (Fast Startup) assessment, see Results for the On/Off Assessments.
segment.target: For more information about how to analyze results for the Boot (Fast Startup) assessment, see Results for the On/Off Assessments.

segment.source: Issues
segment.target: Issues

segment.source: The On/Off Transition Performance assessments perform advanced issue analysis and provide links to Windows® Performance Analyzer (WPA) to troubleshoot the issues that the assessments have identified.
segment.target: The On/Off Transition Performance assessments perform advanced issue analysis and provide links to Windows® Performance Analyzer (WPA) to troubleshoot the issues that the assessments have identified.

segment.source: When WPA opens, additional details about disk activity or CPU activity might be available, depending on the type of issue.
segment.target: When WPA opens, additional details about disk activity or CPU activity might be available, depending on the type of issue.

segment.source: For more information about in-depth analysis issues and recommendations, see Common In-Depth Analysis Issues.
segment.target: For more information about in-depth analysis issues and recommendations, see Common In-Depth Analysis Issues.
